front.title: SPRING Use Cases for Software-defined Networking

abstract.t: In the SDN (Software-Defined Networking) architecture, an SDN controller decides and establishes flow paths. As an SDN controller provides control plane functions by communicating with switches, the latency of control functions is an important issue. Source routing is applicable to improve the performance of SDN. In this document, we illustrate SDN source routing use cases of flow setup and failure recovery.
